body_html:
I am using a wrapper around the tensorflow stft. So in my code it is working.
Nevertheless, it is annoying, when tensorlfow provides a stft and istft and you have to provide optional arguments to get the behavior correct.

As I mentioned in my first post, I would suggest introducing a forward_window_fn to the istft to be able to give it a proper default.
body_text:
I am using a wrapper around the tensorflow stft. So in my code it is working.
Nevertheless, it is annoying, when tensorlfow provides a stft and istft and you have to provide optional arguments to get the behavior correct.
As I mentioned in my first post, I would suggest introducing a forward_window_fn to the istft to be able to give it a proper default.
body:
I am using a wrapper around the tensorflow stft. So in my code it is working.
Nevertheless, it is annoying, when tensorlfow provides a stft and istft and you have to provide optional arguments to get the behavior correct.

As I mentioned in my first post, I would suggest introducing a forward_window_fn to the istft to be able to give it a proper default.
